# Question

Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Sure, here is an example of how you could implement a show method in Julia:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T <: Real}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, f::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(f.value) $(f.unit)")
end
```
This `show` method accepts an I/O stream and a FloatWithUnits object as arguments. It then prints out the value and unit of the struct in a single string. The fields are accessed using dot notation (e.g., f.value, f.unit).
